org.beryx.textio

Class StringInputReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beryx.textio.InputReader<String,StringInputReader>
      • org.beryx.textio.StringInputReader

  • public class StringInputReader
extends InputReader<String,StringInputReader>
    A reader for string values. Allows configuring the minimum and maximum length, as well as a regex pattern. By default, it uses a numbered list for displaying the possible values.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • getDefaultErrorMessage

        protected List<String> getDefaultErrorMessage(String s)
        Description copied from class: InputReader
        If no errorMessageProvider exists, this method is used to provide the list of error messages for the input string s. It should return a non-empty list of messages.
        Overrides:
        getDefaultErrorMessage in class InputReader<String,StringInputReader>

      • checkConfiguration

        public void checkConfiguration()
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: InputReader
        Checks if the reader is correctly configured. This default implementation checks if the defaultValue is among the possibleValues.
        Overrides:
        checkConfiguration in class InputReader<String,StringInputReader>
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

        Parses the input string
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        s - the input string
        Returns:
